subject: Using junit with extensions that inherit from TestCase - how to do?

messageBody:
Hello,

I'm attempting to use MockRunner with JUnit 3.8.1. The test classes
using MockRunner extend from MockRunner's BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter
rather than JUnit's TestCase (although BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter itself
extends TestCase). When I run the tests at the command line

"C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_06\bin\javaw.exe" -cp
.;E:\software\development\junit3.8.1\junit.jar junit.awtui.TestRunner
BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter test.testResultSet2ArrayList

the TestRunner GUI starts but states "Load Test Case..." at the bottom
and does nothing else.

To make sure the problem was with BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter, I
commented out the test class' body and executed the tests again. The
same result occured. However, when I replace BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter
with TestCase (and modify the imports accordingly) TestRunner gives me
a "no tests found" failure notice. Therefore, I'm pretty sure that
TestRunner is not recognizing BasicJDBCTestCaseAdapter as a testable
class.

To put my question in a general sense, how can TestRunner recognize
class A that extends class B that extends TestCase as testable?
